description.narrative: By 2016, girls and boys (0-5) living in households in the poorest communities in 9 countries (Antigua and Barbuda, Dominica, Grenada, Montserrat, St. Kitts and Nevis, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, St. Lucia, Trinidad & Tobago and Anguilla) have access to quality developmental and education services

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN House Marine Gardens Christ Church BARBADOS

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, girls and boys (0-5) living in households in the poorest communities in 9 countries (Antigua and Barbuda, Dominica, Grenada, Montserrat, St. Kitts and Nevis, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, St. Lucia, Trinidad & Tobago and Anguilla) have access to quality developmental and education services

description.narrative: Through advocacy and capacity building initiatives UNICEF collaborated with partners and key stakeholders in the ECD Sector to promote and support the provision of equitable care, protection and early learning opportunities for all children in early childhood settings. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Standardized tools available to assess the developmental progress of children in the 0-3 cohorts at national level. Yes/No

actual.value: 2016:12 countries monitor developmental progress at national level through the Primary Health Care System.

title.narrative: % of boys and girls (0-5) in the poorest communities having access to quality early childhood services in 4 countries
# of child-centred curricula approaches for ECD being implemented at national level.

actual.value:
2016:Four (4) countries have identified a National Curriculum .
9 countries have a new framework to guide curriculum development and implementation.

title.narrative: National Plans that comprehensively address the needs of the ECD sector for increasing access to quality services for the most disadvantaged girls and boys available Yes/No

actual.value: 2016:8 countries - a combination of ECD Strategic Plans and Integrated Education Sector Plans

title.narrative: ECD regulatory frameworks and standards' documents submitted to Cabinet for approval and gazetting? Yes/No

actual.value: 2016:11 countries have ECD standards/ regulations which were approved by cabinet.

title.narrative: ECD policies submitted to Cabinet for approval and gazetting? Yes/No

actual.value: 2016:8 countries have ECD policies which were approved by cabinet

ECD services for girls and boys are monitored using national standards. Yes/No

actual.value: 2016:9 countries assessed 50% or more of the ECD centres for quality .
